titles: Wednesday the 27 August, 1651. Mr. Speaker, by way of report acquaints the House of the great appearance of the militiaes of London, Westminster, Southwarke, and the hamblets of the Tower, on Monday last in Finsbury feilds, ...
author: England and Wales. Parliament.
notes: Title from opening lines of text.
Place of publication and publication date inferred.

The speaker reports the appearance of the militia at Finsbury Fields on Monday, 25th inst.: whereon a vote of thanks is passed to the Lord Mayor, &c., of London, etc. for their affection to Parliament. Ald. Pennington, Sir John Bourchier, Ald. Atkin, and Ald. Allen to return thanks -- Cf. Steele.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
